userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] James Roy Welch Papers, M0257, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: City attorney, San Jose, California (1895) and Superior Court Judge, Santa Clara County, California (1904).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Legal papers relating to Judge Welch's term as city attorney of San Jose and as Superior Court Judge, Santa Clara County. Also includes a small amount of personal papers and photographs.

did.unittitle: Judge James Roy Welch Papers re:
1) Reorganization of California Cured Fruit Association
2) Business and struggle with California Prune and Apricot Growers Association ("Sunsweet") 1921
4) 1920s cases, petitions, bills re: Judges' Conference, Salary, Retirement with State Legislators (public), Friend Richardson (executive).
5) Denial of citizenship to aliens who did not accept draft in 1917
6) Personal and Business Affairs re: automobiles, repairs(where only 32 cars in Santa Clara County.-Welch had Winton Phaeton (sp?)) 1902
Commissions/ documents: recovered money for depositors on complex Union Savings Bank litigation; (bank looted by officers).
Some photos: Boulder Dam + Death Valley (1935)
